title: Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Burcham Hills Retirement Community (East Lansing, MI) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very casual. The questions are based on experiance. Talk about your privious work or even problems you had to overcome while you were in school and they would love to hear about it.
Interview Questions: What did you do to overcome a problem at work.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Burcham Hills Retirement Community
Interview Descriptions: Friendly staff who made me feel comfortable and they were willing to work with my schedule since I hadn't quit my last job yet. I enjoyed the tour of the facility.
Interview Questions: Which unit would I like to work.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Burcham Hills Retirement Community
Interview Descriptions: Thorough, the interviewer wanted to know where I had worked, what my plans are for the future, what my idea of nursing was, why I wanted to become a nurse.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Fitness Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Burcham Hills Retirement Community
Interview Descriptions: I enjoyed the experience and the questions were well thought out and very professional. I really felt welcome because I felt that Burcham Hills wanted me, it made me excited to find out the next steps after the interview.
Interview Questions: How do I stay organized and think under stressful situations

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Burcham Hills Retirement Community (East Lansing, MI) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very easy. One of the managers asked me a few typical questions and I received an acceptance email shortly after.  Would not worry too much about the interview.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Burcham Hills Retirement Community (East Lansing, MI)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very managed in a very efficient and timely fashion that also worked with my availability. The interview team was very effective, explained the role thoroughly, and went out of their way to be sure that all of my questions were addressed. They did a great job keeping me informed throughout the process.
Interview Questions: I was asked to describe how I would bring value to the organization.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Burcham Hills Retirement Community
Interview Descriptions: The interview  process was favorable. The human resources team was very helpful. The online application was easy to follow. I felt supported and challenged. The team at Burcham Hills was kind and caring in the interview process.

title: Nurse Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Burcham Hills Retirement Community
Interview Descriptions: Interview was quick. On the spot, HR will tell you "YOU GOT THE JOB! WELCOME!"  It was a good experience for a newly graduate. Meeting new people; good and bad and lazy. Overall, I learned some lessons and techniques.

title: Certified Nurse Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Burcham Hills Retirement Community (East Lansing, MI) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: About a half hour interview process at the facility. Questions included asking about times you had to work with a hostile coworker, situation, what you would do if you saw someone treating a resident improperly, if you knew what a resident's rights were and how to promote them and times you had to work as part of a team.
Interview Questions: If you caught someone mistreating a resident, what would you do?

title: Universal Caregiver Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Burcham Hills Retirement Community in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Burcham Hills is a wonderful place with some of the nicest people I have ever come across. Management seemed very nice. management seemed to have a wealth of knowledge on this type of community and educates themselves as well as all other employees i met on the most recent accomplishments.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult person situation?
